intro: Anisocycla cymosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite and oval, often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Anisocycla cymosa is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
